description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, local bodies maintain a child- and gender-friendly governance system for integrated planning, monitoring and investment in accordance with their child profile, investment plan, status report and minimum indicators on child survival, development, protection and participation

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, local bodies maintain a child- and gender-friendly governance system for integrated planning, monitoring and investment in accordance with their child profile, investment plan, status report and minimum indicators on child survival, development, protection and participation

description.narrative: In the changed federal context, UNICEF advocacy and influence has resulted in child right issues being mainstreamed in the final Local Governance Act 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of local bodies (DDC, municipalities) have completed CFLG adoption processes incorporating gender considerations

actual.value: 2017:In priority districts, 90% (9 out of 10) municipalities council decided to adopt CFLG. District level declaration could not happen for a single district because of changing political context and restructuring of the country, whereas the indicator set for municipality is largely me 9 out of 10 munici

title.narrative: % of DDCs, VDCs and municipalities that have allocated their resources based on an inclusive budget provision as per the Government guidelines

target.value: 2017:(DDC, Municipality, VDC) 10 per cent for Children, 10 per cent for women, 15 per cent for disadvantaged

actual.value: 2017:% of DDCs allocating resources for children is 10% on an average for all 75 districts. Municipalities that have adopted CFLG (58 municipalities out of 192 former municipalities) have been reported to allocate 15% resources for children whereas the remaining municipalities have allocated 10 % resourc
